subject: Alpine.js Devtools Launched
body:
You can now get the Alpine.js Devtools, (repo is [Te7a-Houdini/alpinejs-devtools](https://github.com/Te7a-Houdini/alpinejs-devtools)), you can get it as a [Chrome Extension](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/alpinejs-devtools/fopaemeedckajflibkpifppcankfmbhk) or [Firefox Add-on](https://addons.mozilla.org/firefox/addon/alpinejs-devtools/). Big thanks to [@Te7aHoudini](https://twitter.com/Te7aHoudini) for kickstarting that project, and [@ryangjchandler](https://twitter.com/ryangjchandler) for his previous forays into it. 

Late last week (a couple hours after the latest newsletter issue went out), Alpine.js passed 6k stars on GitHub, we're now sitting around 6.2k, pretty cool to see the influx of people in the issues and the Discord.

The Alpine.js Community helped Caleb [refactor `x-for` during a YouTube stream](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qkjKSZV9csA).

As part of Alpine.js Weekly I've released [Alpine.js Collections: components, tools, articles, demos & more](https://alpinejs.codewithhugo.com/?type=components) where you'll find an always up to date, categorised list of items featured on the newsletter (past & future).

Some cool new projects are leveraging Alpine.js

- [Zambian Pay As You Earn (PAYE) tax calculator](https://paye.emediazambia.com/) by [@eddyshivers](https://twitter.com/eddyshivers) is [made with Alpine.js](https://twitter.com/eddyshivers/status/1248715412348551169)
- [challengeteacher.online](https://challengeteacher.online/) by [@emd](https://twitter.com/emd) [uses Alpine.js (amongst other things)](https://twitter.com/emd/status/1251155999072768000)


## Articles & Tutorials

This week, you can build an [Alarm clock using Alpine.js](https://medium.com/@rakeshbhatt/alarm-clock-using-alpinejs-de1e39f972e3) by Rakesh Bhatt.

There's a lot of buzz around using [Alpine.js and TailwindCSS for prototyping](https://twitter.com/wschenk/status/1230601007886983190), here's [How to make interactive, code-based prototypes that feel like the real deal, even if you suck at JavaScript](https://www.jedlehmann.com.au/how-to-make-interactive-code-based-prototypes-that-feel-like-the-real-deal-even-if-you-suck-at-javascript/) by [@UnknownGuest](https://twitter.com/UnknownGuest)

[(Video) Laravel Movie App - UI Interactivity w/ Alpine.js - Part 5](https://youtu.be/y4Ki5_Q2-gs)

[Animate with Alpine.js](https://dev.to/benbao/animate-with-alpine-js-gbi) by [@benbao93](https://twitter.com/benbao93)

[Getting started with Alpine.js](https://blog.logrocket.com/getting-started-with-alpine-js/) by [@LogRocket](https://twitter.com/LogRocket)

[Pseudo Computed Properties in Alpine](https://ryangjchandler.co.uk/articles/pseudo-computed-properties-in-alpine/) by [@ryangjchandler](https://twitter.com/ryangjchandler)

[Integrating Alpine.js with Eleventy & YAML files to create Alpine Playground's Collections](https://codewithhugo.com/eleventy-collections-yaml-alpinejs/)

A couple of new episode from Caleb's [Building Alpine.js](https://laracasts.com/series/building-alpinejs/) series: [Episode 3 - Making Things Reactive](https://laracasts.com/series/building-alpinejs/episodes/3) and [Episode 4 - Event Listening](https://laracasts.com/series/building-alpinejs/episodes/4).

## Code & tools

No need for an Easter hunt to get demos this week:

- [A todo list](https://codepen.io/ryangjchandler/pen/qBOEgjg) by [@ryangjchandler](https://twitter.com/ryangjchandler)
- Calendar UI with TailwindCSS and Alpine.js](https://codepen.io/mithicher/pen/OJyVPBY) by [@mithicher](https://twitter.com/mithicher).
- In memory of John Conway, [@unlikenesses](https://twitter.com/unlikenesses) wrote [Conway's game of life in Alpine.js](https://codepen.io/unlikenesses/full/NWGqdEL)
- A "probably shouldn't be used in production" [quantity selection widget using Alpine.js](https://codepen.io/piotrpog/pen/BaoydJg) by [@PiotrPogorzel](https://twitter.com/PiotrPogorzel)
- [Ajax Loading a page into a modal with Alpine JS](https://gist.github.com/terryupton/287ca7c3023fa59e7d24da302e1d03d5) by [@terry_upton](https://twitter.com/terry_upton)
- After discussion in the Discord server, [@ryanjchandler](https://twitter.com/ryanjchandler) shared [his attempt at an Alpine.js datatable using data set as HTML on the page](https://codepen.io/ryangjchandler/pen/WNQQKeR) and here's [another datatable one using x-data](https://codepen.io/wulfheart/pen/povYZZN)
- [AlpineJS Dynamically Injected Nested Components](https://codepen.io/jreviews/pen/gOapqzb) by [@getJReviews](https://twitter.com/getJReviews)

No release this week, but the [Alpine.js Devtools](https://github.com/Te7a-Houdini/alpinejs-devtools) have beend launched as both a [Chrome Extension](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/alpinejs-devtools/fopaemeedckajflibkpifppcankfmbhk) and a [Firefox Add-on](https://addons.mozilla.org/firefox/addon/alpinejs-devtools/).

[@ryangjchandler](https://twitter.com/ryangjchandler) has been playing around with [implementing Vue-style filters in Alpine.js](https://twitter.com/ryangjchandler/status/1250813956178001923) you can see it working at [Alpine.js filters for x-text](https://codepen.io/ryangjchandler/pen/eYpZYVr).

## Code & Tools

A little bit of progress on [Alpine.js devtools](https://github.com/Te7a-Houdini/alpinejs-devtools) with support for booleans, numbers and alpinetoolbox.com apparently. Check this repo out for how to test an Alpine.js application.

### 2.3.0


Features:

- `.self` event modifier: `@click.self="foo"` (only run if the event originated on the listening target)
- Updates to docs: NPM version badge, "nomodule" pattern for IE11 build
- Refactored structure of x-for system

Fixes:

- All Chromium and WebKit browsers were causing "keydown" listeners to fire on "autocomplete" #389
- Accessing outer loop variables from inner loop variables was broken
- bind `:value` on an `<input type="radio">` with x-model as an attribute 
- `$nextTick` was finishing before certain refreshes were finished updating
- Safari bug that caused x-model inputs to make the cursor jump when the value was updated

[See the full release notes](https://github.com/alpinejs/alpine/releases/tag/v2.3.0)

subject: Tips for Alpine.js Productivity
body:
If you still haven't installed them, the latest version of the community devtools is available [on Chrome](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/alpinejs-devtools/fopaemeedckajflibkpifppcankfmbhk) and [for Firefox](https://addons.mozilla.org/firefox/addon/alpinejs-devtools/).

Not too many demos this week:

- [Count characters typed - AlpineJS](https://codepen.io/xewl/pen/vYNJxLg) by [@Xewl](https://twitter.com/Xewl/status/1255863205362118658)


This email is supported by [Codecourse](https://codecourse.com/?ref=alpinejsnewsletter). Practical screencasts for developers (including Alpine.js!).

To make up for the lack of demos, I found some awesome tips to share, thanks to [@brbcoding](https://twitter.com/brbcoding/status/1222944134387859456) and [@anu](https://twitter.com/anu/status/1254104828411854857?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw):

- > 🤦‍♂️ If you're using "x-show" with [@Alpine_JS](https://twitter.com/Alpine_JS?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw) and wondering why there's still a flash of hidden content despite tacking on "x-cloak", make sure you don't forget to add "[x-cloak] { display: none; }" to your CSS. Little gotcha that bit me on a new project...
> 
> — Placebo Domingo ([@brbcoding](https://twitter.com/brbcoding/status/1222944134387859456)) [January 30, 2020](https://twitter.com/brbcoding/status/1222944134387859456?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)
- > Useful tip for anyone using [@Alpine_JS](https://twitter.com/Alpine_JS?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw) and [@phpstorm](https://twitter.com/phpstorm?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw) – add the AlpineJS directives as custom HTML attributes to remove warning lines. Also enables autocompletion 🎉  
>   
> Settings > Editor > Inspections > HTML > Unknown HTML tag attributes [pic.twitter.com/5VkUKSSLgB](https://t.co/5VkUKSSLgB)
> 
> — anu ([@anu](https://twitter.com/anu/status/1254104828411854857?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)) [April 25, 2020](https://twitter.com/anu/status/1254104828411854857?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)

If tips aren't your thing and you're just stuck, feel free to ask in the Alpine.js [Community Discord](https://discord.gg/snmCYk3) or on [StackOverflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/alpine.js)/[GitHub Issues](https://github.com/alpinejs/alpine/issues)
